number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 10, 2014
												Counter-Strike, as pure as an online FPS can be.Yes. It is now an old game. With outdated graphics. Simple static environments. No fancy explosions. No vehicles. No fuzz.But that is exactly this game's strength. That purity and focus on realistic weapon mechanics and online multiplayer only. Pure skill, pure FPS love.And when you become an old impatient gamer like me and you only need that quick fix of pure FPS online action now and again. You don't want to wait for the game round to end when you die. You don't want to worry about team play...That's when you start to play The Mod within The Mod. Gungame of course.Evolving from the round based one-weapon-upgrade-per-round and respawn-next-round, to Gungame Turbo and then to the current Gungame Turbo Deathmatch. Instant weapon upgrade and instant respawn. It has become The Ultimate Fix. Super intense, forcing everyone to play with all the weapons in the game, competing against players in your own team as much as the opposite team. It has truly become one of the best deathmatch games out there, hands down.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 9, 2014
												Counter-Strike: Source is a remake of Counter-Strike, and retains its team-based objective-oriented first-person shooter style gameplay. The aim of playing a map is to accomplish a map's objective: defusing the bomb, rescuing all hostages, or killing the entire opposing team. The ultimate goal of the game is to win more rounds than the opposing team. Once players are killed, they do not respawn until the next round on most servers. This gameplay feature distinguishes Counter-Strike from other first-person shooter games, where players respawn instantly or after a short delay.Shooting while moving dramatically decreases accuracy, and holding the trigger down to continuously shoot produces severe recoil. Shot damage depends upon where the bullet hits, with hits to the head often being lethal.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 6, 2014
												There was a time, when this game was new. Graphics revealing, handling strange for the veterans. It was when a lot of people would say: "bah, you play Source? 1.6 or Condition Zero is way better, it's a classic!"Now this game has become old itself. And I feel old, having this realization. That CS:GO is already out there, with a growing fanbase.But why do I keep coming back to CS:Source? Every once in a while I will start this game and play a few rounds and it will make me feel good. I just think Source has extremely satisfying movements, weapon feeling and the graphics are just good enough. For a competing shooter I don't need anything else. Source keeps the perfect balance between the old, a-bit clunky feeling of 1.6 and the over-heavy, much slower and more realistic handling of CS:GO. I don't need too much realism, I don't need  bullet-spraying weapons, that don't hit, when they're supposed to!For me, Counter Strike Source will always be the best shooter, because I grew on it. And I think there are a lot of people out there, that feel the same way. If you are below the age of 20, go for something else, otherwise this is the best dope you ever need for a quick and casual round. And there are also some nice mods out there, gungame, surfing, zombiemods, rpg, jumping, bunnyhopping maps, etc.... Man, I hope the servers will stay alive for some more years...Now I have to call my friends and ask for a LAN, in remembrance of good ol' times

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 26, 2014
												I rediscovered this gem when my video card kicked the bucket, and I was on an ancient 7800GT trying to find something it could still play in 2013.  Fortunately I stumbled upon the wonderful sFa server and became a part of their community.  Fun gameplay, awesome people... what's not to love?If you're unfamiliar with the gameplay of Counter-Strike, it's a round-based team elimination first-person shooter with slightly asymetrical objectives.  The most common mode has the terrorists trying to plant a bomb, and the counter-terrorists trying to defuse it if that happens.  Another popular mode requires the counter-terrorists to rescue hostages that the terrorists are guarding.  Frequently, the two teams will simply fight each other until only one is left standing.  There's an in-game money system that allows you to buy better equipment if you survive and do well, but many servers give free money at the start; this allows everyone to pick whatever guns they want.Why choose Source instead of Global Offensive?  Well, as new generations of gamers have moved on to CS:GO or Call of Duty, CS:S has retained a generally more adult crowd and relaxed atmosphere.  It's like hanging out in a pub after work, except you're all shooting at each other.  Another advantage of playing a game that was top-of-the-line 9 years ago is that it still looks alright today, but it will run buttery smooth on just about any hardware.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 6, 2014
												There was a time, when this game was new. Graphics revealing, handling strange for the veterans. It was when a lot of people would say: "bah, you play Source? 1.6 or Condition Zero is way better, it's a classic!"Now this game has become old itself. And I feel old, having this realization. That CS:GO is already out there, with a growing fanbase.But why do I keep coming back to CS:Source? Every once in a while I will start this game and play a few rounds and it will make me feel good. I just think Source has extremely satisfying movements, weapon feeling and the graphics are just good enough. For a competing shooter I don't need anything else. Source keeps the perfect balance between the old, a-bit clunky feeling of 1.6 and the over-heavy, much slower and more realistic handling of CS:GO. I don't need too much realism, I don't need  bullet-spraying weapons, that don't hit, when they're supposed to!For me, Counter Strike Source will always be the best shooter, because I grew on it. And I think there are a lot of people out there, that feel the same way. If you are below the age of 20, go for something else, otherwise this is the best dope you ever need for a quick and casual round. And there are also some nice mods out there, gungame, surfing, zombiemods, rpg, jumping, bunnyhopping maps, etc.... Man, I hope the servers will stay alive for some more years...Now I have to call my friends and ask for a LAN, in remembrance of good ol' times

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 10, 2014
												Counter-Strike, as pure as an online FPS can be.Yes. It is now an old game. With outdated graphics. Simple static environments. No fancy explosions. No vehicles. No fuzz.But that is exactly this game's strength. That purity and focus on realistic weapon mechanics and online multiplayer only. Pure skill, pure FPS love.And when you become an old impatient gamer like me and you only need that quick fix of pure FPS online action now and again. You don't want to wait for the game round to end when you die. You don't want to worry about team play...That's when you start to play The Mod within The Mod. Gungame of course.Evolving from the round based one-weapon-upgrade-per-round and respawn-next-round, to Gungame Turbo and then to the current Gungame Turbo Deathmatch. Instant weapon upgrade and instant respawn. It has become The Ultimate Fix. Super intense, forcing everyone to play with all the weapons in the game, competing against players in your own team as much as the opposite team. It has truly become one of the best deathmatch games out there, hands down.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 24, 2014
												At first I had no interest to play this game, I only brought it for the Garys Mod textures but while I waited for servers to load, I tried out the game and I was hooked. It's my favorite game for numerous reasons:                        1.Unlike more know shooters[COD]which have a horrible community, most players here are here to have fun, not to scream like baby's each time they die2.Never once have I come across a hacker, all servers I'm on are hacker free and so I have a great experience.3.Unlike games that have microtransactions for guns or gun skins or use a pay to win system, CS Source has zero transactions and I heard the newer CS has those types of transactions.4.The game has a more exciting and risky feeling to it. It doesn't have respawns until the round is over or rewards for killstreaks since knowing you have stopped someone from causing your team trouble is reward enough.I feel this game is better than the newer CS which has more hackers, transaction and screaming kids.CS Source has a more realistic feel to it and I think the extra 5 dollars are worth it.
